definitions.definition: A small freshwater fish , Gobio gobio , that is native to Eurasia .
( Canada ) Cottus bairdii , more widely known as mottled sculpin .
( Australia ) Any of various similar small fish of the family Eleotridae , often used as bait .
Other fish, similar in appearance, principally in families Butidae and Eleotridae , but also in others.
( figurative , archaic ) A person apt to take the bait ; one easily cheated or duped ; also, an idiot .
( figurative , archaic ) Something used to lure or tempt ; bait , a lure .

main_definition: A small freshwater fish , Gobio gobio , that is native to Eurasia .
secondary_definitions: ( Canada ) Cottus bairdii , more widely known as mottled sculpin .
( Australia ) Any of various similar small fish of the family Eleotridae , often used as bait .
Other fish, similar in appearance, principally in families Butidae and Eleotridae , but also in others.
( figurative , archaic ) A person apt to take the bait ; one easily cheated or duped ; also, an idiot .
( figurative , archaic ) Something used to lure or tempt ; bait , a lure .

definitions.definition: A circular or cylindrical fitting , often made of metal , into which a pin or pintle fits to create a hinge or pivoting joint .
In a vessel with a stern - mounted rudder : the fitting into which the pintle of the rudder fits, allowing the rudder to swing freely .

main_definition: ( also attributively ) A circular or cylindrical fitting , often made of metal , into which a pin or pintle fits to create a hinge or pivoting joint .
secondary_definitions: ( nautical , specifically ) In a vessel with a stern - mounted rudder : the fitting into which the pintle of the rudder fits, allowing the rudder to swing freely .
